title: Seriously, teemo needs a rework or a buff. He doesn't work in any of the latest metas.
body:
How long since you saw a teemo?
I can tell you : for me, it is over a year. Simple because he has no space in the meta. A ranged squishy top laner in a era where top laners can do wolves easily, come lvl 2 to lane, and them shit on his face. His shrooms are also easy to counter because of sweeping lens and the river crab.

In a world where gnar exists, and , in lane, has the same purpose, but becomes a monster of CC and high base damage on teamfights, why would you EVER pick teemo?

And please, don't come with that old mindset of " we hate teemo, we don't care " . It is like "nerf irelia" when irelia hasn't the most nerfed champions of all times.

replies.body: He doesn't need a rework, he just needs some moderate number and kit changes. His spells can probably all stay the same, but he could use some trades in power across his kit for more options. For example, I always thought it would be cool if his shrooms did less base damage, but did damage based on missing health so they didn't just take a carry out before a fight began, but were made even deadlier for those that were low on health.

The whole purpose of Teemo isn't to dominate teamfights like Gnar. It's for overall map control. His mushrooms help you get objectives, get picks on the enemy team, provide vision in the jungle, constantly push waves, etc. He's not necessarily a champion that fits into the meta, he's an anti-carry. He negates the efforts of ADCs and melee carries and champions that rely on auto attacks, and helps the rest of your team take them out by making their carry weaker. He's not a selfish champion. He's a team-player champion. That's my 2 cents.

Teemo changes I'd like to see to give him a defined role (no numbers, compensatory nerfs would likely need to happen):

* Teemo moves faster when moving towards targets poisoned by his shrooms. Gives him an assassin role, as both a cleanup champion and a "bait" champion.

* Missing health poison damage on his Q. Fits his theme, and solidifies him more as an assassin than a "sort've kinda duelist maybe".

* Slight shift in power to the on-hit damage on his E rather than the poison, or allow the poison to have "stacks" that increase the damage per tick, or give a current health damage effect (either poison or on-hit). At the moment, building attackspeed is only *sort've* good. It *seems* like it should be good, but raw AP and Pen, like a mage, are usually vastly more effective since the only really useful roles you have in a teamfight are "lead them through shrooms" or "blind their ADC/fighter". 
* % increase to poison damage dealt to blinded enemies.

* Small buff to shroom reload time.


Perhaps nerfs would have to accomadate these, but frankly, there'd be a REASON to have a teemo on your team. At the moment he has no use in a teamfight and is situational at best. This'd give him a role as both a "pick" assassin, who hunts down enemies who stray onto his shroom and assassinates them while they're separated from their team. This would also give him a role as an "anti-frontline" in teamfights, who whittles down the enemy team's hp before the fight even begins so as to either deter them from engaging or soften them up for an engage from *your* team.

Again, numbers would have to be specifically tuned, but I don't think the issue with Teemo is necessarily his power level, I think it's that there's *no team that wants the champion in their team comp*. There's no reason to choose teemo over a different top/mid/jungle. This would give him a reason to be picked.

I think these would probably work perfectly for his Assassin role (out of invisibility) because the only thing he has in terms of Assassin is his invisibility when idle, and his invisible shrooms that can be placed anywhere for 10 minutes at a time.
I like playing as Teemo, but I think people don't want him in any team comp because of how he just doesn't work anywhere or with anyone at the moment, and how if he starts to get behind, then he will always stay behind, and there is nothing that can bring him back up to be with everyone else.

Really his shrooms were balanced around a tank meta, then they got major nerfed because everything changed when the assassins attacked. Now that we're back to a tank meta, he is probably just underwhelming. I say probably because i actually haven't seen a teemo or played as him since the shift.

So you're going to rework a champion simply because the player induced meta that shifts bi-weekly doesn't include him? Boo hoo your favorite champion won't be viable for a while. Why not just be patient instead of complaining about him, and maybe he will be buffed or nerfed either outright or by stealth. However with teemo I highly doubt it. His current kit would go from being insanely annoying to insanely overpowered if they were to buff him. His near infinite kite potential plus heavy burst AND DoT damage to go with two different kinds of CC and three built in escapes? (his speed up, mush slow and passive) The only reason he isn't pick or ban is because he is so squishy that so much as looking at him with a mean-ish expression is enough to kill him. Imagine if he was a bit more resilient. He would never die.

He hasn't been viable (in high-level play, as anything other than a narrow and mediocre counterpick) for *years*.
